I would use the **read_file** tool to read the configuration file.

**Tool:** read_file  
**Arguments:** I would pass the path "/etc/config.yaml" as the path parameter.

**Why this is appropriate:** The read_file tool is specifically designed to read and return the contents of files. Since you want to view the configuration file at /etc/config.yaml, this tool will retrieve and display the file's contents so we can see what configuration settings are stored there.
